title: Peaceful perfect weekend get away from hustle and bustle
review: Lansdowne is the closest hill station around 280 kms from Gurgaon in Uttrakhand for perfect peaceful leisure vacation.

title: A quiet and clean place to relax
review: You can unwind yourself in a place which is not very crowded and also very green . You can relax with family and friends and refresh yourself  and enjoy the nature around you . There are lot of places to enjoy the beauty of nature in the nearby areas .

title: Beautiful but over crowded place
review: Lansdowne the home of Garhwal Rifles, is a quaint small town lying near Pauri. The views and scenic beauty is mind blowing and the town itself is neat and clean with almost proper roads and connectivity. The disadvantage is that it has been the weekend destination for the people of Delhi NCR region and hence there is lot of rush and cars zooming in, since the roads are not broad traffic jam is ensured.

title: Tiny hill station.
review: Peaceful, calm and unexplored Hill station nearest to Delhi.  Very well maintained by Garwal Regiment.

title: Excellence in hills -- Lansdowne
review: I really enjoyed the nature for the 2 nights taht i stayed , temperatures of -4 degree were awesome to experience and enjoy.

title: Good Place for weekends
review: A quick distance from Delhi. Can be covered by normal driver,  though to visit tarakeswar temple you need a expert driver. There are few average budget hotels available at main market. But many resorts are available through out the radius. Tip and Top is not having such magnificent view as other Hill station.  Very lonely place,  untouched.  Hence nature lover definitely like this place.  Must visit,  santoshi maa temple,  army museum, lake, siva temple,  durga Mata temple. And not to miss Tarakeswar Temple. 2 days trip can cover all the area.

title: Perfect Weekend RoadTrip
review: This is a proper hill station approx. 250Km+ from Delhi and a perfect weekend trip with friends or family. We actually covered the whole place and where back in the same day. We started from Delhi at 5am and reached Lansdowne by 11am. We visited a couple of sightseeing places, Tip Top Point primarily, spend some time there, had lunch and afternoon 2pm to left for Delhi. If you wish, there are loads of places to spend the night, camps, hotels and GMVN as well has cottages in the hill station you could stay. We reached Delhi by 11:30pm. On the way back we got more traffic and hence took us more time. In the end, it was 650Km in one day, taxing if you have one guy driving. If you have multiple drivers, can be covered in one day quite easily.

title: A peaceful and beautiful cantonment establishment
review: We did stay outside of the city and explored ito the neat clean cantonment city of Lansdown. Covered the places of attractions like St. John Church, St. Marys Church, Tip & Top, etc.

title: Lansdowne
review: A pleasant military (!) station of Garhwal Rifles. Weather is sunny in day, chilly in night. We stayed at Lansdowne Resort  which is a private resort inside the military station. It is a set of 2 bungalows circa 1912 with family rooms. The two churches in Lansdowne are peaceful. Good views of the hills are everywhere. The military bugle sounds every few hours when the soldiers stand erect wherever they are. Tadakeshwarnath mandir is about 37 km away. The tiredness of the last 5 km of this temple route is wiped out by the small temple nestled in a wooded plain. Bhulla lake with it's garden is a typical example of the army keeping things interesting in a rough terrain. Remember the rule for hilly areas: fill the car petrol tank (Dugadda) before you arrive at destination,  do not imitate the local drivers who rush down the winding roads, stick to your side of road. On way from Delhi the road section from Ghaziabad to Modinagar and from Miranpur to Bijnore was bad.

title: Quick escape from Delhi
review: The location is famous for blue pines. What makes the place popular is its proximity to Delhi. It’s 2 hours drive from Kotdwara.

title: A nice place for relaxing
review: This hill station is different from others, as its less crowded. It is basically comes under cantonment area. You can relax and enjoy the natural beauty. Market is small . There were no special tourist point. Best place to stay: Apline resort and Blue pine Resort

title: Awesome Place, Great Experience
review: Lansdowne is a must visit place for travel lover people.

title: Best place to spend a weekend
review: Lansdowne is quite famous place among travelers but not that much crowded like other tourist place. It is peaceful place because of the less crowded. It was nice experience for me to visit lansdowne but i heard from many travelers that it was boring. It is very peaceful place and one of the best place to take break from from your hustle bustle life

title: A visit to Lansdowne
review: We visited Lansdowne from 05/05/2018 to 07/05/2018 and stayed at S.B.Mount resort. To reach the hotel one has to cross a small pedestrian bridge which is a beauty itself. The rooms are spacious with beautiful view of a swallow river and hill outside.

title: Lansdowne
review: The palce is a paradise amidst the Garhwal Hills. Its tranquil and serene. A perfect weekend getaway. Nature's beauty for photographers and trekkers..

title: Good weekend spot
review: Nice place to visit for weekend gateway from Delhi. You can relax since there are not much things to do over here so you can enjoy with family in the hotel with the nice view. Also, nature loving guys can go for jungle walk.

title: Wanna Relax, go Lansdowne
review: This is a small, scenic and tranquil hill station. Visit here only if you are looking for a calm stay. It has got plenty of Hotels which have all basic+ amenities. Very less tourist attractions and mobile signals are also relatively weak. Overall a small yet powerful package

title: Chill in a quiet place
review: We wanted to go to the hills and not meet our neighbours. So the idea of Lansdowne came up.

title: A must visit destination for peace seekers not for the people who search for mobile networks when they reach someplace!
review: Surrounded by oak and thick blue pine forests, well connected by road and yet unspoiled by blatant commercialism, at 1700mts above sea level, Lansdowne qualifies as a hidden gem of a hill station.

title: Nearest hill station near Delhi.
review: Visit it only if you love nature and peaceful atmosphere . A very small market ..Having a wine shop also.

title: Lansdowne- One of the finest hill stations near Delhi
review: I have visited Lansdowne a couple of times now, and it never fails to enthrall me. It is around 260 kms from Delhi, and the if you leave around 4 am, and then you ll reach Lansdowne by 10 am for sure.

title: Super destination
review: Love the place and weather is wonderful.... Very peaceful and clean .... You never find another tourist places after goes to Lansdowne

title: Hidden Gem in Uttarakhand just 6 hours away from Delhi by road
review: About 270 odd kilometres from Delhi, Lansdowne is a hill station destination to get away from the crowd. We were lucky to drive down mid week for a trip lasting three days and it was very peaceful. There are quite a few good properties to stay in on the main road just short of Lansdowne - Samskara and Samsara Homestay, Kasang Regency, Hotel Ravine Palace, Rio Resorts, Corbett Hill Resorts take your pick, but remember to pre-book during long weekends. Approaching winter and we had great views of the mountains and the stars close enough to reach out to at night. Hiking around the hills to enjoy the views, driving to the Tarkeshwar Temple about 40 kms further away on a hillside - strangely the only hillside with Deodhar trees in the area, and checking out the secluded little stone churches in the cantonement area is a great way for nature lovers to enjoy some solitude amidst pollution free surroundings.

title: worth if you want relaxation from Daily Schedule nothing to explore!!
review: There is nothing to explore. The only part which is drive from Lansdowne to Tarkeshwar Temple which is 30+ kms makes it average destination.

title: Lansdowne-just 6hrs from delhi
review: A great getaway option for weekends. the roads are pretty good which makes the journey  more amazing. The stay is good and since the place is not much crowded it is a good option for relaxing.

title: Pride of Garhwals
review: Lansdowne is a place where as you enter you feel proud to be indian, a must visit for patriotic people. This place have amazing temples with vibrant history, amazing cliff tops and one of the best cantt. areas of India.

title: Small peacefull Hill station !!!
review: Lansdowne, a small hill station situated in garhwal on the way from Kotdwar to Pauri.

title: Holy trip.
review: It was very cold their, if anyone is planning to go their in the month of November then pack your bags with all warm clothes and be prepared to face freezing nights.

title: Nothing much to explore !
review: Good place for nature lovers, nothing much to explore but peaceful, calm and aesthetic place .......

title: Peace & Solitude
review: For peace lovers. Don't carry your work & conflicts to Lansdowne. Relax in solitude. The area around Tip-n-top & beyond is made for nature lovers to explore. If in a hurry, please go somewhere else.

title: Escape for few Days
review: Lansdowne is a very small place with very less activities there.

title: Nothing to do in Lansdowne :-(
review: Lansdowne is a place away from hush hush but you won't find a temperature difference you are expecting. There is nothing to do in Lansdowne really and there is only Garhwal Regiment headquarter.

title: Very beautiful scenery and calm place
review: It's perfect place for weekend tour with family and friends. Very calm and beautiful place to stay and enjoy the weekend.

title: Not good
review: I have been to manali , mussoorie , nainitaal.. but lansdowne was the worst option I could ever go for. Nothing to view.. no market or place to rome.. not too good weather.. actually not my type of place..

title: A small heaven nestled amidst clouds
review: It is one of the most beautiful and less commercialized hill stations in North India. There are not too much places to visit but just enough so u will not regret at the end of trip that u did not rest enough. Clouds are always forming and even enter your hotel room if u leave windows open. The way to Lansdowne after u cross Kotdwara is too beautiful with abundance of small waterfalls downhill and on the road. At certain places u will certainly get down from ur car and get drenched in water. Lansdowne is Army controlled so u will experience peace n greenery.

title: Boring place
review: Total waste of money and time never visit again weather also not good only raining not good food court and restaurant in market

title: Weekend Outing
review: Had an amazing weekend and enjoyed a lot.The traveller facility  was also very nice we did not face any kind of challenge while our on road travel.Moreover they provided extra bisleri bottles which served well.Overall a very nice trip had fun !! Kudos to guruji travellers!!

title: Best place to Rejuvinate your Senses
review: It's a tiny town maintained by the Garhwal Regiment of the Indian Army.

title: Amazing
review: Lansdowne is best place for nature lovers. Walking in early morning is like a heaven.

title: Excellent weekends Destination
review: We stayed at Hotel Hill Top Forest Place.

title: Go here if you love Peace! Don't of you are a tourist !!
review: Lansdowne is one of the less known hill stations near Delhi but its going to get busy sooner. It is basically a Army establishment and hence a no non-sense place. There is literally nothing here other than awesome views, peaceful walks, sweet people and beautiful sunsets and sunrises. Tourists please avood going here because you will NOT find a Mall Road or a PVR cinema or a water fall.

title: Weekend Picnic spot for Delhites
review: Lansdowne is set amidst lovely surroundings – tall oaks and blue pines rise like spires off the mountainside. The forests are lovely, dark and deep, just ideal for those long walks and picnics. There are amazing mountain views of the Western Himalayas from a number of vantage pints like Snow View and Tiffin Top. A number of treks into the hillside are launched from Lansdowne, which is a popular base camp. The nature treks range from simple hiking trails of a few hours or one day’s duration, to tougher climbs lasting a couple of days. Garhwal Tourism will organize these treks for you.

title: Long Weekend Trip From Delhi
review: Lansdowne is a small hill station in Garhwal region, a Cantonment area maintained by Garhwal regiment of Indian army. The roads are nice and clean and the wandering roads with twists and turns from Lansdowne to Kothdwar is actually the best part to see.

title: Quiet, hill station , not much explored
review: Small hill station with just 8000 people as its population, mainly occupied by army,  well Organised roads, a calm getaway from delhi for extended weekend holidays.  Enjoy the kura range of Himalayas, doing nothing but to relax, have a good walk , enjoy beauty , sunrise at tip in top .

title: Its very peaceful hill station
review: Its only 350 kms from delhi and very less tourists its non so popular hill station like manali, shimla. It has less attraction point then other hill stations, but its very peaceful all area is under army cantt. Hotels are very less in this place.

title: Good for weekend outing
review: Surroundings are beautiful... Not so busy or commercialized place... Its a good place to spend your weekends to get a little away from your daily traffic nd routine... Its just the surroundings and the environment to fall for... If you'r more of tourist person than nothing much to wander around...

title: Peaceful hill station away from crowds
review: The good thing is that the place is not so popular yet so it makes a perfect place to for a serene, scenic vacation over the weekend. Being a cantonment area, it's well maintained and you can sit in any corner of the road or up in the mountains doing just nothing. Better if you take your own vehicle as taxi walas fleece you 100-200 minimum for even more 1 km. Locals are very friendly and do take some trek packages with traditional breakfasts like the one arranged by Oak Grove Inn.

title: Calm place
review: Approachable by road, no luxurious restaurants and hotels, lush green, avg altitude 1500 mts, quiet place. For those who love short mountain trekking in lush green mountains it's a good place. Just pack your bag, choose a mountain, explore, find your way and enjoy.

title: Beautiful
review: Lansdowne is one of the quietest and unspoilt hil station that I've been to.

title: Lansdowne unspoilt tourist destination
review: Lansdowne is a quiet n unspoilt hill station surrounded by thick oak n pine forests in the Pauri  Garhwal district of Uttrankhand state.

title: Beautiful place
review: This place is full of lovely nature and cute peoples. Locals here are very cooprative and soft spoken. This place has iconic beauties of nature and peoples who want to explore the nature should visit here.

title: A quite getaway up in the hills of Garhwal.
review: A weekend getaway from  Delhi, around 270 Kms away . A beautiful drive during and post monsoons.

title: Beautiful place for short trip
review: Ultimate satisfaction you get on seeing clouds and experiencing cool breeze on your trip to any hill station.....we got it at lansdowne in the month of july....experience was awesome

title: Good
review: Nice location to hangout in a lonely planet , not much crowded in the month.

title: Quite, peaceful hill station to spend 1 day
review: This hill station is around 3 hours away from Haridwar.

title: Excellent
review: Its a small town.Very peaceful & full of natural beauty .Its main advantage is still away from commercialization,This place is perfect destination for city people wanting to have some peace

title: For peace and quiet
review: Landsdowne is not a typical "hill-station" so as to speak. It has literally nothing to do.....and if that's what you are looking for then its a perfect place for you. And if you want to avoid the mad rush of a touristy town then that's another reason to head here!

title: Awesome Place with Tranquility and Calmness
review: A destination to brace with freshness and tranquility, Ideal place to enjoy week end and short holidays. Beautiful views and charming greenary makes this place perfect for rejenvuation and feel romantic.

title: A Place right in the Lap of Mother nature.
review: If you are looking for a peace of mind? If you want to be enjoying nature to the fullest? If you want to do trekking? The place is Lansdowne. The place is full of treks and is as beautiful as you can imagine. The Place is full of Churches, Temples. it also has an Army Museum and a lake. There is alot to explore in this area.

title: A really nice place away from all the noise of Delhi-NCR
review: We were a group of four friends looking for some timeout from all the haywire of Delhi/NCR. 1 of my friends suggested to visit this place and I am really thankful for that suggestion.

title: Idle escape for individuals searching for peace
review: The most green, peaceful place with the sweetest people. A must visit for a weekend getaway from Delhi. Do stay at Fairydale Resort, its the best.

title: Very peaceful
review: If you are looking for something very peaceful and close to nature then lansdowne is a perfect place. Although There is nothing much to see and hotels are over priced and very limited in number. It would be better to get bookings done before you reach. It's a perfect for those looking for calm and relaxing holiday.

title: Serene place
review: It took almost 9 hrs to reach there from delhi due to packed jam in Merrut.Peaceful place not so much crowded as other hill stations ,Must visit TIP N TOP as it offers you best view of Himalayas ,prefer to spend most of the time at TIP N TOP as it is the best place in Lansdowne ,Bhulla taal has not much to offer as it is small lake.

title: Serene
review: Not at all a sleepy hill station yet with wonderful views all around . To reach here might be an issue with roads crossing infamous villages of UP.

title: Home Away from Home
review: Lansdowne has suddenly come into limelight as this hill station retains much of its natural charms due to its non commercialization here.

title: It is for the very reason you go to a hill station....
review: Lansdowne is the perfect escape for a traveller, specially one from a busy city.  There is no much sight seeing, which is a plus point according to me.   But as usual someone tried to convert a water hole (Bhulla Tal) as a lake and put some ugly looking paddle boats, which was totally unnecessary.  Avoid this place it is totally useless.  You can try St. Merry's church, Garhwal rifle museum etc. If you travel by your personal vehicle then it is always convenient, otherwise also there are lot of transport available from Kotdwar and at the same time you will get chance to do some casual trek, which i think will be the best option to explore this place. Avoid weekends, if not avoidable please book a hotel in advance, there are not many places in Lansdowne to spend the night.

title: Serene, quiet, clean, pristine and beautiful
review: Serene and not crowded. Very beautiful. You can stroll freely in the lanes and find more and more locations. There are only a few tourist spots and they are teeming with people. We took a stroll towards Jaiharikhal. It was so quiet and beautiful.

title: Aaaaaahhhhhh.......Thats the feeling...
review: Can i say more, the best and the most serene of environment. Its a garisson town so you should expect cheap liquor and good food. Also is very clean. The only issue is at some hotels you will not find mobile connectivity. But that should be ok since you go there to relax. Depending upon hotels you will get Wifi facility.

title: Weekend of sereneness
review: An awesome place for a weekend away from Delhi. A 250 km drive through winding roads (beware people who find hilly roads tizzy) and you reach the calm & quiet of Lansdowne. The time for rest, relaxation & family. Not much places to roam around and honestly chilling out without running around crowded tourist spots is what you should seek there.

title: A sneeze away from Delhi!
review: This is the place to go to when you are dying to get out of the city but don't have enough time to go traipsing to far off hills! By road you could be in Lansdowne in 5 hours approx. There are two dainty little churches which will fill you up with joy as soon as you spot them from a distance!

title: Weekend Getaway - Good views, peaceful
review: If you are looking for a weekend getaway from Delhi, then Lansdowne is a good place for it. Even though the places has mostly temples to visit (Jwalpa Devi Temple, Santoshi Mata Temple, Durgadevi Temple, Sidhhbali Temple), yet there are some other places such as Bhulla Tal lake (boating - a must do activity), Tip-n-Top point and St. Mary's Church which are close to nature filled with emmense peace and calmness.

title: Weekend getaway
review: Beautiful place...where u can tk brk frm ur hectic schedule n relax...small city..u can walk arnd. ..not many tourist spots..bt mind refreshing area..n peaceful. .especially d resort where v stayed. .fairydale..beautiful place to stay

title: Lansdown- a nice alternative to crowded places
review: One of the best hill stations, not crowded. A good  2-3 days peaceful location.

title: Lovely Lansdowne
review: Lansdowne is a quiet and peaceful place mainly due to the military presence in the area - there are quite a few retired army officials residing.

title: Foreign tourists BE AWARE! The rest enjoy.
review: Arrived to Lansdowne to learn we could not stay on the hill as its a military cantonment area....and thus the hotels on the hill can not take foreign tourists over night, which they do not inform you about!

title: A very beautiful place
review: To begin with, the route from kotdwar to lansdowne is full of natural beauty with river, hills, pines trees, clean and crisp air etc. you would just enjoy your journey. take your time to visit Siddhibali Mandir and Durga Mata Mandir enroute to Lansdowne. also spend some time by river. these are unforgettable experiences.

title: For relax trip
review: I reside in delhi . Wanted to get away from daily hussle bussle life of city for a day .

title: Green Nature all around
review: Lansdowne is not for shopping and sight seeing. Go if you want to take walks and enjoy the views. The hills are not deforested and are totally green unlike any other hill station in North India.

title: Pefect weekend getaway in Nature's Lap
review: If you are tired of the hustle & bustle of NCR & want to relax in nature's lap on weekend, Lansdowne is the perfect weekend destination.

title: Lansdowne, Utrakhand
review: Visited this place on 15th-16th Aug' 2015. Weather was cloudy with intermittent sunshine. Do carry your umbrella/ raincoat if you happen to visit the place during this time of the year.

title: Calm and Serene
review: Lansdowne is not for those people who want a mall road, crowded hill stations, fast food chains, etc.

title: Quiet and peaceful
review: A quiet and scenic place.visited on 3rd weekend of august.Lots of clouds,weather was mesmerising.No mall road or big market.This place is for those people who want to spend some quality time away from mad city life.

title: beautiful...
review: i went there with the whole family..its a beautiful place ...very quite...the views from the top is magestic..really had a good time..will go there again..

title: Actually hidden heaven and place in the clouds
review: Lansdowne Is one of the quitest hill station of Indian, very few people known about this town,  located in Uttaranchal. There is no hide nor hair cycle rickshaw like in Mussorries.

title: Weekender with office colleagues
review: Lansdowne is a typical cantonment area. Didn't find much to see and do apart from the Tip-N-Top aka Tiffin Top and Sunset Point. One can visit for a peaceful and relaxing weekend.

title: Mesmerizing place
review: A place so beautiful that you feel you are in heaven. One can just go there and relax and spend quality time with family. It is an amazing place for 1 night 2 day stay. Don't expect too many attractions to see, just take the walk and enjoy this place.

title: nothing much to do
review: its a typical cantt area. there is a lke on which boating was going on. I dont thing there is anything for kids. although there is an army outlet from which we bought some souvenir.

title: A peaceful non-commercialized hill station
review: Lansdowne is a peaceful, nice hill station away from the hullabaloo of commercialized overcrowded stations. Though there is nothing much to do but you can rest and absorb the beauty of nature. As it is cantonment area so found very clean.

title: A nice lazy getaway
review: Lansdowne is one the most nicest getaways from Delhi or places near Uttrakhand. Its an army cantonment area and therefore a relatively clean hill station. Its not too crowded for people who like to visit unexplored places. Lansdowne does not have many attractions but its a great place to spend a lazy weekend away from the city hustles. The main market is at the Gandhi chow or the gandhi market.

title: LANSDOWNE..
review: It was a pleasant and mindfreshing moment.. We can escape into the depth of silence which makes us refresh in a shot time..

title: Lansdowne Hill Station
review: Lansdowne is one of the quietest and unspoilt hill stations of India. Lansdowne is unlike other hill stations, as it is well connected with motorable roads but remote in its own way,driving down makes it more pleasurable , because of the less traffic.surrounded with thick oak and blue pine forests..

title: Excellent Place
review: Away from the hustle bustle of the city, a perfect place to relax in your weekend. Stunning views, quiet and calm place.

title: Lansdowne - A road less travelled
review: Lansdowne is a small quite town in Garhwal which is not commercialized. There is literally nothing to do.

title: Beautiful place for photographs
review: Its a beautiful place to go and feel the scenic beauty. After the toiling work this is one place which is not only near to Delhi but also has the capacity to rejuvenate. Going to Lansdowne was one of the most relaxing trip I have ever had. There is not much to see apart from a few temples and relaxing walks amidst the nature but the whole experience lightens the mood and reduces the tension. Just a weekend trip for peace of our mind.

title: Beauty of Himalayan Hills but need to sustain it.
review: I m a native of Lansdowne town, its a small but natural beauty. If you are a nature lover,this place is for you.

title: A Perfect Weekend Gateway
review: Nice serene and peaceful place unlike other Hill stations No hustle Bustle.

title: Nice Place Away From City
review: Nice place to visit during winter season. Tipen Top s must to see place to get 360 view of Himaliyan mountains. Good place to visit once to relax your mind and body. Small place not much to do. Its natures lover place. If you love nature you need to visit once.

title: A visit to Virgin  Land
review: Lansdowne is one wonderful hill station  in India which is not overcrowded,no senseless over construction, not commercialized.A calm place ,simple people,pine forest,nice trekking,food simple home food.Best place to spend some cool,quality time with your family.Only fear is that there are some leopards around as told by locals, they are not man eaters ,seems never attacked so far anyone but who would like to encounter a leopard ,so be careful while trekking.place is neat and clean and basically Army area ,Garhwal Rifles,If you have army background you can stay in Garhwal Mess, army guest house or check trip ad visor for hotels.Jungle Anand Retreat with cottages are another place is great to stay.must visit for natural loving traveler and great for photography ,Himalaya range amazing view ,Sun rise and sun set are worth watching.

title: Good quite place, recommended for nature lovers
review: Its a small town(read very small) but the beauty nature has bestowed is simply awesome. A perfect weekend gate-away. Sight seeing, weather and the calmness in the surroundings were the things i liked most. Only disadvantage is its does not have activity/points were you could go and enjoy with kids, otherwise this place is really nice

title: Untouched and Calm
review: We visited In Jan'15. it is one of the best places in uttaranchal we have visited.. Very well maintained , Calm and Quiet, few tourists, helpful people.. Must visit for star gazing and nature lovers.. You can just spend the whole day on nature walk.. Just 250 kms from Delhi and comfortable travel from Delhi via Khatauli..

title: Charming - very rustic!
review: It was quite cold when I visited, and it did hamper my experience a bit. However, that was probably because I stayed in the army barracks with little luxury. I am pretty sure the nearby hotels are more cosy!

title: Heavenly  Lansdowne
review: We visited Lansdowne in June 2014. We travelled by road from Dehradun. While the road via Rishikesh is a little shorter, we took the Haridwar-Nazibabad-Kotdwara route as this route is on plain ground and we could reach Lansdowne faster. Lansdowne is a sleepy town with excellent scenic beauty. In the evening the clouds came and we got lost amidst the fog. There are a few places to see-Tip and Top, Bhulla Tal and the Darwan Singh Museum in the cantonment.. The army mess has a beautiful collection of artefacts of British days including the signature books and photographs of all army chiefs since lansdowne became a cantonment..One should also visit the Tarakeswara Shiva temple located in the beautiful pine forest 40 km away from Lansdowne

title: Place for nature lovers
review: Lansdowne is a place for nature lovers away from concrete jungle. Its around 250 Km from Delhi with good road connectivity. Its a headquarter of the famous Garhwal Rifles of the Indian Army. I wouldn't say it is one of the top hill stations like Nainital & Manali but its very peaceful with scenic beauty of snow covered Himalayas. You can find good hotels with awesome views from room. This is the first hill station which I found without Mall Road. Lansdowne has limited attraction points like Tip-N-Top, Bullah lake, & Temple. As this place is near to Jim Corbett National park, you can encounter with Tiger, Leopard, Elephant & deer (if lucky).

title: Good and peaceful place
review: If you are a nature lover, than this is a must visit for you.  This place is a very neat and clean place and good hideout for 1-2 days.

title: Awesome and quite Place
review: The ideal place if you want to go to a hill station with calm and quite atmosphere. There is no market so that you can go and relax in the resort. Sight seeing is good and the climate is awesome. You feel clouds entering your room..

title: Peace full Lansdowne
review: Lansdowne is located in Uttarakhand near Pauri. It is one of the peaceful hill station I have ever seen. As this hill station is  a cantonment area, commercialization has not done here like any other hill station.This is 250 km away from delhi.

title: Lansdowne is a beautiful hill station !
review: Lansdowne is a cantonment town in Pauri Garhwal district in the Indian state of Uttarakhand.Lansdowne is about six hours by car from Delhi (it is 245km away). Plan your journey in such a way that you complete it before sunset, so that you can catch glimpses of some of the most beautiful locations on your way to the quaint little town. .If you're interested in photography, this could well be your vantage point.  St Mary's Church was built by the British community in 1896, the Garhwal Rifles has made sure the church retains its old- worldly charm. History buffs shouldn't miss the old photographs and souvenirs on display inside. there is a small waterwall in deep jungle you can reach there through mountain trekking of around 1.5 Km starting from The jungle resort Anand retreat. The cool air and amazing vistas provide you with unforgettable experiences.

title: lansdowne-kotdwar-corbett
review: lansdowne is a stylish hill station similar to Mcluskigunj in Jharkhand. one time British Health Resort to pass peaceful old age. it is in garwal near pauri and is accessible from Delhi by nicely amintained road at adistance of 250 kms. nearest rail station is Kotdwara which itself is a place for leisure holidays. one can plan atrip like this: Nainital or Ranikhet-2 nights, Jim Corbett National Park-2 nights, Lansdowne--2nights, thus a week holiday.

title: Peace full Place...
review: If you want to see places and do lot of sightseeing than this is not the place for you....Instead if you want to spend a peace full weekend than pack your bags and visit this place ...The best part is you are away from your mobile too...As most of the time you wont find signal and promotion calls for personal loan and new Credit Card.:-)  So you will be away from everyone and can enjoy the peace full time in Lansdowne.

title: A room with a view
review: Visited this place in 2012  With family and relatives,stayed at Fairydale resorts,a resort in the heart of Lansdowne. Had a lovely time walking with the family and children on the mountains.Lovely views of the snow clad peaks in the far distance.

title: Excellent View of Hills and Lake and Pines
review: Visited Lansdowne in Dec 2013 with my wife Ruma and my friend Anindya and his family. We stayed at Fairydale Resorts. It is a beautiful place sarrounded by hills. The resorts also very good.

title: A serene out of the world hill station
review: Lansdowne is a small hill town in the hills of Uttarakhand. one must go there for peace of mind and to unite with nature. One has to go with a open mind for enjoying the natural beauty and the calmness. This is a no go for shopping ccrazy folks

title: Not much developed yet very clean
review: LANSDOWNE

title: Few tourist-spots,fewer tourists:Serenity rules!!
review: If you want a quiet time with few people around then head to Lansdowne. Within a distance of around 250km from Delhi; the place is NCR's next door hill station.
